metas.name: Kobayashi-san Chi no Maidragon Samishii Gariya no Ryuu
metas.description:
Genres: Fantasy, Slice of Life Tags:Seinen/Dragons/Maids/Found Family/Female Protagonist "I don’t want to let go of her hand. Because, we are a family."

Theatrical follow-up to the second season Kobayashi-san Chi no Maidragon S and Kobayashi-san Chi no Maidragon S: Nippon no Omotenashi (Attend wa Dragon desu) OVA.

(Source: Kyoto Animation YouTube Channel)

metas.name: JUJUTSU KAISEN: Hidden Inventory / Premature Death – The Movie
metas.description:
Genres: Action, Drama, Supernatural Tags:Curses/Urban Fantasy/Boys' Love/Shounen/Exorcism/Demons/Super Power "The strongest duo—A youth they can never return to."

Compilation film of Jujutsu Kaisen 2nd Season's "Kaigyoku・Gyokusetsu" (Hidden Inventory / Premature Death) arc.

Before they were enemies, Satoru Gojo and Suguru Geto were high school classmates and friends. The two most powerful sorcerers are tasked with protecting Riko Amanai, a student who has been designated to be sacrificed as the Star Plasma Vessel, until she can fulfill her duty. Pursued by a religious cult and other curse users, they are the only sorcerers capable of carrying out such a difficult task – but this mission will set their destinies, and challenge the two sorcerers in ways unimaginable.

(Source: GKIDS)

metas.name: Lost in Starlight
metas.description:
Genres: Drama, Romance, Sci-Fi Tags:Heterosexual/Primarily Adult Cast/Space Opera/Astronomy/Urban In 2050 Seoul, astronaut Nan-young’s ultimate goal is to visit Mars. But she fails the final test to onboard the fourth Mars Expedition Project. The musician Jay buries his dreams in a vintage audio equipment shop. The two fall in love after a chance encounter. As they root for each other and dream of a new future. Nan-young is given another chance to fly to Mars, which is all she ever wanted…

(Source: Netflix)

metas.name: Dream Animals THE MOVIE
metas.description:
Genres: Action, Adventure, Fantasy Tags: Dream Animals biscuits, a long-selling snack beloved by Japanese since its launch in 1978 has been sold in more than 20 countries around the world and features the animal names written in English on the biscuits. The product has enjoyed an explosion in popularity in recent years as merchandise, especially among young people. Now for the first time, the product is given treatment as an animated movie called Dream Animals: The Movie. How will these animal biscuit characters behave and sound as they embark upon a thrilling adventure while tugging at your heartstrings with endearingly rich personalities.

(Source: TBS)
